Blog.post: Got a phone call from my brother Pete the other day telling me that Dad hasn't been well.My Dad is 88 years old and been in a old peoples home for 4 years.Until quite recently he's been in reasonably good health, but his mind has been going . He's got senile dementia, its got to the stage where the ppl at the oap-home cant look after him anymore, so he's being moved to a home dedicated to his condition. I havnt seen Dad in 6 years, i wish i had, thats the problem with emigrating to the other side of the world its a lot harder when somthing happens to family back home. I'm in two minds wheather i should go an see him, Pete said thats it would be a shock to see him now, or should I just remember him as he was.

The day after I got my new iPod, Apple anounced a new version - typical ! they dropped the 15g version and knocked $100US off the price with longer battery life too. Just my luck, but i dont care I like mine a lot.

Got a new gadget over the weekend, an 15g iPod and its brilliant. Loaded almost my entire music collection onto it, and there's still 10g free space left. Like most apple stuff its beautilfuly designed, but it really needs a protective cover, the chrome plating on the back looks like it will scratch very easily, a remote control would be handy too.

I love shoot-em-up games and my favourate game at the moment is Wolfenstein Enemy Territory. One of the great things about the game is that there is a version that runs under Linux and even better is that its free, no need to reboot to windows have fun (er i mean work :-) ) any more.
